modules.description: Provides functions to generate pseudorandom byte sequences using ChaCha20, ChaCha8, and ChaCha12 algorithms, with a C-implemented hot loop for performance. Operates on 32-byte or 16-byte keys and 8-byte nonces to produce output streams. Used for encrypting data streams and generating secure random values in cryptographic applications.

Generates encrypted output by applying the ChaCha20, ChaCha12, and ChaCha8 stream ciphers to byte sequences represented as Cstruct.t. Each function takes a 64-byte key and nonce, producing a 64-byte keystream for XOR-based encryption. Used in secure communication protocols to obfuscate data payloads.

Provides functions to create and manage ChaCha encryption states using key and nonce, supporting ChaCha20, ChaCha12, and ChaCha8 variants. Operates on Cstruct.t for input and output data, with encryption and decryption performed directly on byte sequences. Used for securing data streams with variable-round ChaCha ciphers in cryptographic protocols.
